intro: Sisymbrium longepedicellatum, commonly known as the long pedicel mustard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the fruit is a slender, elongated pod containing several seeds. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of habitats.
